title: Commending Zev and Helen Birnbaum, recipients of the Avodas HaKodesh Award at the 59th Anniversary Banquet of the Flatbush Park Jewish Center on March 27, 2011
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION commending Zev and Helen Birnbaum upon the occa-
sion of their designation as recipients of the Avodas HaKodesh Award  at
the 59th Anniversary Banquet of the Flatbush Park Jewish Center on March
27, 2011

WHEREAS, The quality and character of life in the Empire State is great-
ly  enriched  by  the  faithful and generous service of those who devote
themselves to endeavors of family, faith and community; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative  Body  to  recognize  and
commend  individuals  of such magnanimous conduct and bearing who demon-
strate a deep and continuing  concern  for  others,  and  in  so  doing,
inspire others to do the same; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern and fully in accord with its long-
standing traditions, it is  the  intent  of  this  Legislative  Body  to
commend Zev and Helen Birnbaum upon the occasion of their designation as
recipients  of the Avodas HaKodesh Award at the 59th Anniversary Banquet
of the Flatbush Park Jewish Center, to  be  held  at  Kings  Terrace  in
Brooklyn on Sunday, March 27, 2011; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Flatbush Park Jewish Center has grown from a storefront
congregation of 45 families to become one of  New  York  City's  leading
Orthodox  congregations;  it  has  evolved  into a true center of Jewish
communal life, serving the religious, educational and  social  needs  of
the young and old of Brooklyn's Mill Basin community; and
  WHEREAS,  Zev  Birnbaum has ably served as Gabbai of the Flatbush Park
Jewish Center for many years; Helen Birnbaum has served as an officer of
Sisterhood and has devoted much of her time to leading  the  synagogue's
Bikur Cholim Committee; and
  WHEREAS,  Throughout  the course of their service to the Flatbush Park
Jewish Center and their community, Zev and Helen Birnbaum have exhibited
uncommon valor and wisdom; their involvement and  leadership  have  been
characterized  by an impressive commitment, an unbridled enthusiasm, and
an uncompromising standard of excellence in all their endeavors; and
  WHEREAS, Zev and Helen Birnbaum  are  sincerely  devoted  members  and
leaders  of  the Flatbush Park Jewish Center and their community as well
as generous supporters of many worthy programs and causes at the Center,
in the community, and in Israel; and
  WHEREAS, This Legislative Body is proud to extend its highest  commen-
dation  to Zev and Helen Birnbaum for their dedication and commitment to
their community and their heritage; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause in its deliberations to pay
tribute to Zev and Helen Birnbaum upon the occasion of their designation
as recipients of the Avodas  HaKodesh  Award  at  the  59th  Anniversary
Banquet  of the Flatbush Park Jewish Center on March 27, 2011; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Zev and Helen Birnbaum.
